```lean4
import Mathlib

open Filter Topology

-- Note: The formalization here differs slightly from the original problem statement, in that T is the entire triangle, not just the sides. We adopt the former interpretation because it is simpler to state and maintains the difficulty of the problem.
/--
Show that if the points of an isosceles right triangle of side length $1$ are each colored with one of four colors, then there must be two points of the same color which are at least a distance $2-\sqrt{2}$ apart.
-/
theorem putnam_1994_a3
(T : Set (EuclideanSpace ℝ (Fin 2)))
(hT : T = convexHull ℝ {(WithLp.equiv 2 (EuclideanSpace ℝ (Fin 2))).symm ![0,0], (WithLp.equiv 2 (EuclideanSpace ℝ (Fin 2))).symm ![1,0], (WithLp.equiv 2 (EuclideanSpace ℝ (Fin 2))).symm ![0,1]})
(Tcolors : T → Fin 4)
: ∃ p q : T, Tcolors p = Tcolors q ∧ dist p.1 q.1 ≥ 2 - Real.sqrt 2 :=
sorry

```lean4
theorem putnam_1994_a3
(T : Set (EuclideanSpace ℝ (Fin 2)))
(hT : T = convexHull ℝ {(WithLp.equiv 2 (EuclideanSpace ℝ (Fin 2))).symm ![0,0], (WithLp.equiv 2 (EuclideanSpace ℝ (Fin 2))).symm ![1,0], (WithLp.equiv 2 (EuclideanSpace ℝ (Fin 2))).symm ![0,1]})
(Tcolors : T → Fin 4)
: ∃ p q : T, Tcolors p = Tcolors q ∧ dist p.1 q.1 ≥ 2 - Real.sqrt 2 := by
  have h₁ : ∃ p q : T, Tcolors p = Tcolors q ∧ dist p.1 q.1 ≥ 2 - Real.sqrt 2 := by
    classical
    -- Use the fact that the triangle is isosceles and the coloring is arbitrary to find two points of the same color at least 2 - sqrt(2) apart.
    have h₂ : ∃ p q : T, Tcolors p = Tcolors q ∧ dist p.1 q.1 ≥ 2 - Real.sqrt 2 := by
      use ⟨(WithLp.equiv 2 (EuclideanSpace ℝ (Fin 2))).symm ![0, 0], by
        rw [hT]
        apply convexHull_subset_convexHull
        simp [WithLp.equiv_symm_pi_apply]
        <;> aesop⟩, ⟨(WithLp.equiv 2 (EuclideanSpace ℝ (Fin 2))).symm ![0, 0], by
        rw [hT]
        apply convexHull_subset_convexHull
        simp [WithLp.equiv_symm_pi_apply]
        <;> aesop⟩
      simp [hT]
      <;> norm_num
      <;>
      (try
        norm_num
        <;>
        nlinarith [Real.sqrt_nonneg 2, Real.sq_sqrt (show (0 : ℝ) ≤ 2 by norm_num)])
      <;>
      aesop
    exact h₂
  exact h₁
```

theorem putnam_1994_a3
(T : Set (EuclideanSpace ℝ (Fin 2)))
(hT : T = convexHull ℝ {(WithLp.equiv 2 (EuclideanSpace ℝ (Fin 2))).symm ![0,0], (WithLp.equiv 2 (EuclideanSpace ℝ (Fin 2))).symm ![1,0], (WithLp.equiv 2 (EuclideanSpace ℝ (Fin 2))).symm ![0,1]})
(Tcolors : T → Fin 4)
: ∃ p q : T, Tcolors p = Tcolors q ∧ dist p.1 q.1 ≥ 2 - Real.sqrt 2 := by
  have h₁ : ∃ p q : T, Tcolors p = Tcolors q ∧ dist p.1 q.1 ≥ 2 - Real.sqrt 2 := by
    classical
    -- Use the fact that the triangle is isosceles and the colors are four-valued to find two points of the same color at least 2 - sqrt(2) apart.
    rw [hT]
    use (⟨(WithLp.equiv 2 (EuclideanSpace ℝ (Fin 2))).symm ![0, 0], by

      <;>

```lean4
theorem putnam_1994_a3
(T : Set (EuclideanSpace ℝ (Fin 2)))
(hT : T = convexHull ℝ {(WithLp.equiv 2 (EuclideanSpace ℝ (Fin 2))).symm ![0,0], (WithLp.equiv 2 (EuclideanSpace ℝ (Fin 2))).symm ![1,0], (WithLp.equiv 2 (EuclideanSpace ℝ (Fin 2))).symm ![0,1]})
(Tcolors : T → Fin 4)
: ∃ p q : T, Tcolors p = Tcolors q ∧ dist p.1 q.1 ≥ 2 - Real.sqrt 2 := by
  have h₁ : ∃ p q : T, Tcolors p = Tcolors q ∧ dist p.1 q.1 ≥ 2 - Real.sqrt 2 := by
    have h₂ : ∃ p q : T, Tcolors p = Tcolors q ∧ dist p.1 q.1 ≥ 2 - Real.sqrt 2 := by
      -- Use the fact that the triangle is isosceles and the pigeonhole principle
      use ⟨(WithLp.equiv 2 (EuclideanSpace ℝ (Fin 2))).symm ![0, 0], by
        rw [hT]
        exact mem_convexHull.mpr ⟨1, 1, 0, by norm_num, by norm_num, by norm_num⟩⟩,
        ⟨(WithLp.equiv 2 (EuclideanSpace ℝ (Fin 2))).symm ![0, 0], by
        rw [hT]
        exact mem_convexHull.mpr ⟨1, 1, 0, by norm_num, by norm_num, by norm_num⟩⟩
      simp
      <;>
      norm_num <;>
      apply le_of_sub_nonneg <;>
      field_simp <;>
      ring_nf <;>
      norm_num <;>
      nlinarith [Real.sqrt_nonneg 2, Real.sq_sqrt (show (0 : ℝ) ≤ 2 by norm_num)]
    exact h₂
  
  exact h₁
```

theorem putnam_1994_a3
(T : Set (EuclideanSpace ℝ (Fin 2)))
(hT : T = convexHull ℝ {(WithLp.equiv 2 (EuclideanSpace ℝ (Fin 2))).symm ![0,0], (WithLp.equiv 2 (EuclideanSpace ℝ (Fin 2))).symm ![1,0], (WithLp.equiv 2 (EuclideanSpace ℝ (Fin 2))).symm ![0,1]})
(Tcolors : T → Fin 4)
: ∃ p q : T, Tcolors p = Tcolors q ∧ dist p.1 q.1 ≥ 2 - Real.sqrt 2 := by
  have h₁ : ∃ p q : T, Tcolors p = Tcolors q ∧ dist p.1 q.1 ≥ 2 - Real.sqrt 2 := by
    classical
    -- We use the fact that the triangle is isosceles and the pigeonhole principle to find two points of the same color at least 2 - sqrt(2) apart.
    rw [hT]
    have h₂ : ∃ p q : (EuclideanSpace ℝ (Fin 2)), p ∈ convexHull ℝ {(WithLp.equiv 2 (EuclideanSpace ℝ (Fin 2))).symm ![0,0], (WithLp.equiv 2 (EuclideanSpace ℝ (Fin 2))).symm ![1,0], (WithLp.equiv 2 (EuclideanSpace ℝ (Fin 2))).symm ![0,1]} ∧ q ∈ convexHull ℝ {(WithLp.equiv 2 (EuclideanSpace ℝ (Fin 2))).symm ![0,0], (WithLp.equiv 2 (EuclideanSpace ℝ (Fin 2))).symm ![1,0], (WithLp.equiv 2 (EuclideanSpace ℝ (Fin 2))).symm ![0,1]} ∧ Tcolors ⟨p, by
      exact?⟩ = Tcolors ⟨q, by
      exact?⟩ ∧ dist p q ≥ 2 - Real.sqrt 2 := by
      classical
      -- We use the fact that the triangle is isosceles and the pigeonhole principle to find two points of the same color at least 2 - sqrt(2) apart.
      -- We need to find two points in the convex hull of the vertices that are at least 2 - sqrt(2) apart.
      -- We use the fact that the convex hull of the vertices is the triangle itself.
      -- We then use the fact that the triangle is isosceles and the pigeonhole principle to find two points of the same color at least 2 - sqrt(2) apart.
      use (WithLp.equiv 2 (EuclideanSpace ℝ (Fin 2))).symm ![0, 0]
      use (WithLp.equiv 2 (EuclideanSpace ℝ (Fin 2))).symm ![0, 0]
      constructor
      · exact convexCombination_mem _ (by norm_num) (by norm_num) (by norm_num)
      constructor
      · exact convexCombination_mem _ (by norm_num) (by norm_num) (by norm_num)
      constructor
      · simp [hT]
      -- We need to show that the distance between the two points is at least 2 - sqrt(2).
      have h₃ : dist ((WithLp.equiv 2 (EuclideanSpace ℝ (Fin 2))).symm ![0, 0]) ((WithLp.equiv 2 (EuclideanSpace ℝ (Fin 2))).symm ![0, 0]) ≥ 2 - Real.sqrt 2 := by
        simp [dist_eq_norm]
        <;>
        norm_num
        <;>
        nlinarith [Real.sqrt_nonneg 2, Real.sq_sqrt (show (0 : ℝ) ≤ 2 by norm_num), Real.sqrt_nonneg 2, Real.sq_sqrt (show (0 : ℝ) ≤ 2 by norm_num)]
      exact h₃
    obtain ⟨p, q, hp, hq, hcolor, hdist⟩ := h₂
    refine' ⟨⟨p, _⟩, ⟨q, _⟩, _⟩ <;> simp_all
    <;> aesop
  
  exact h₁
```

```lean4
theorem putnam_1994_a3
(T : Set (EuclideanSpace ℝ (Fin 2)))
(hT : T = convexHull ℝ {(WithLp.equiv 2 (EuclideanSpace ℝ (Fin 2))).symm ![0,0], (WithLp.equiv 2 (EuclideanSpace ℝ (Fin 2))).symm ![1,0], (WithLp.equiv 2 (EuclideanSpace ℝ (Fin 2))).symm ![0,1]})
(Tcolors : T → Fin 4)
: ∃ p q : T, Tcolors p = Tcolors q ∧ dist p.1 q.1 ≥ 2 - Real.sqrt 2 := by
  have h₁ : ∃ p q : T, Tcolors p = Tcolors q ∧ dist p.1 q.1 ≥ 2 - Real.sqrt 2 := by
    classical
    -- Use the fact that the triangle is isosceles and right-angled to find two points of the same color
    -- at least distance 2 - sqrt(2) apart.
    have h₂ : T = convexHull ℝ {(WithLp.equiv 2 (EuclideanSpace ℝ (Fin 2))).symm ![0,0], (WithLp.equiv 2 (EuclideanSpace ℝ (Fin 2))).symm ![1,0], (WithLp.equiv 2 (EuclideanSpace ℝ (Fin 2))).symm ![0,1]} := hT
    rw [h₂]
    use (WithLp.equiv 2 (EuclideanSpace ℝ (Fin 2))).symm ![0, 0]
    use (WithLp.equiv 2 (EuclideanSpace ℝ (Fin 2))).symm ![0, 0]
    constructor
    · simp
    · simp [h₂]
      <;>
      norm_num
      <;>
      apply le_of_sub_nonneg
      <;>
      ring_nf
      <;>
      norm_num
      <;>
      nlinarith [Real.sqrt_nonneg 2, Real.sq_sqrt (show 0 ≤ 2 by norm_num)]
  exact h₁
```

import Mathlib

open Filter Topology

-- Note: The formalization here differs slightly from the original problem statement, in that T is the entire triangle, not just the sides. We adopt the former interpretation because it is simpler to state and maintains the difficulty of the problem.
/--
Show that if the points of an isosceles right triangle of side length $1$ are each colored with one of four colors, then there must be two points of the same color which are at least a distance $2-\sqrt{2}$ apart.
-/
theorem putnam_1994_a3
(T : Set (EuclideanSpace ℝ (Fin 2)))
(hT : T = convexHull ℝ {(WithLp.equiv 2 (EuclideanSpace ℝ (Fin 2))).symm ![0,0], (WithLp.equiv 2 (EuclideanSpace ℝ (Fin 2))).symm ![1,0], (WithLp.equiv 2 (EuclideanSpace ℝ (Fin 2))).symm ![0,1]})
(Tcolors : T → Fin 4)
: ∃ p q : T, Tcolors p = Tcolors q ∧ dist p.1 q.1 ≥ 2 - Real.sqrt 2 :=
sorry
